page.title: 17DALRY(KIRK) RELIGION 1
page.content: Most of the inhabitants adhere, nominally at least, to the Church of Scotland, though regular attenders are as elsewhere, in a minority. There is, however, always a good turnout for weddings and funerals. There is now only one functioning church in the village, a handsome early nineteenth century building overlooking the river. Another church, formerly United Free, ceased to function when the two were amalgamated in 1949 and is now in private ownership and semi-ruinous. The small number of Episcopalians attend St. Margaret's Scottish Episcopal church in New Galloway which caters for them and for members of the Church of England who have retired in the area.There is an even smaller number of Roman Catholics, who travel to Castle Douglas,for their services.
